property.name: text
property.value: Please make sure the modelFileName parameter in Architectural model is pointing to an existing MetroII executable model. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

property.name: text
property.value:
The roller plus paper is a cylinder of initial radius R and initial mass M. We assume the roller mass includes the mass of the drive motor armature.
The actual radius Q = R(1-delta*theta/(2*pi)) where theta is angle and delta is paper thickness. The mass is m=Mo(Q^2/R^2)
Moment of inertial J = mass*Q^2 = MoQ^4/R^2 in kgm^2/s^2
theta = integral of omega
The dc motor-roller dynamics are given by the transfer function: omega/V = K/{(Js +b)(Ls_R) +K^2} where: omega is the angularVelocity V in the input voltage K is the eletromotive force constant (Nm/Amp) J is the moment of iertia b is the damping ration in Nms R is the armature resistance in ohms L is the inductance in henrys
The velocity of the paper is that of a point on the surface of the roller, namely paperVelocity = angularVelocity*pi*2*R where the angularVelocity = integral of angularAcceleration. It is assumed that the paper does NOT slip while travelling over the roller.

property.name: text
property.value:
This actor computes the moment of inertia j in kg*m^2/s^2 given the radius of the roller, coreRadius, in meters, the mass of the roller, massOfRoller, in kg, including the motor armature, coreMass, in kg.
The formula is:
J= coreMass*coreRadius^2/2

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.
